task.name: hif_checkproductsize
task.description:
Check interferometry imaging product size and try to mitigate to maximum allowed values. The task implements a mitigation cascade computing the largest cube size and trying to reduce it below a given limit by adjusting the nbins, hm_imsize and hm_cell parameters. If this step succeeds, it also checks the overall imaging product size and if necessary reduces the number of fields to be imaged. Output:
results -- If pipeline mode is 'getinputs' then None is returned. Otherwise the results object for the pipeline task is returned.

param.name: vis
param.description: The list of input MeasurementSets. Defaults to the list of MeasurementSets specified in the h_init or hif_importdata task. \'\': use all MeasurementSets in the context Examples: 'ngc5921.ms', ['ngc5921a.ms', ngc5921b.ms', 'ngc5921c.ms']

param.name: maxcubesize
param.description: Maximum allowed cube size (mitigation goal) -1: automatic from performance parameters

param.name: maxcubelimit
param.shortdescription: Maximum allowed cube limit (mitigation failure limit)
param.description: Maximum allowed cube limit (mitigation failure limit) -1: automatic from performance parameters

param.name: maxproductsize
param.shortdescription: Maximum allowed product size (mitigation goal and failure limit)
param.description: Maximum allowed product size (mitigation goal and failure limit) -1: automatic from performance parameters

param.name: pipelinemode
param.description: The pipeline operating mode. In 'automatic' mode the pipeline determines the values of all context defined pipeline inputs automatically. In 'interactive' mode the user can set the pipeline context defined parameters manually. In 'getinputs' mode the user can check the settings of all pipeline parameters without running the task.

param.name: dryrun
param.description: Run the task (False) or just display the command (True)

param.name: acceptresults
param.shortdescription: Add the results to the pipeline context
param.description: Add the results of the task to the pipeline context (True) or reject them (False).
